title: Bangladesh Army officer cadet wins two top awards at UK military academy
body: Bangladesh Army officer cadet, Sakib Ahsan Rifat, has been awarded both the International Sword of Honour and the International Award at the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst in the United Kingdom. For the first time in Bangladeshâ€™s history, an officer cadet received the two prestigious honours simultaneously from among nearly 200 cadets representing 40 countries at the passing-out ceremony held in London. Princess Anne conferred the award, according to a social media post by the Bangladesh high commission in London. Rifat was adjudged the best-performing international cadet and received the International Sword of Honour for outstanding military performance, said the Inter-Services Public Relations in a separate press release on Saturday. He also secured third place overall in the course based on combined academic and military performance and ranked first among international cadets, for which he was awarded the International Award. Rifat underwent training at RMAS from November 25, 2024, to December 13, 2025. He passed his Higher Secondary Certificate examination from Comilla Cadet College in 2022 and later joined the 89th long course of the Bangladesh Military Academy as an officer cadet. In recognition of his exceptional merit and performance at the Bangladesh Military Academy, he was selected to attend the one-year commissioning course at the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst.
